TEXT.P: Two new lines have been added to this graph for "fully developed" and "senescent" fisheries (columns C and D, respectively).
A fishery that has been fully explored and is being harvested to its maximum capacity is considered fully developed. Catches stop growing and become stagnant.
Eventually, if a fishery is harvested intensely over an extended period, catches begin to decline and the fishery is considered senescent. This is overfishing.
Answer questions 3 and 4 in the assignment.
When you have finished, proceed to Step 4.
